api

Interface Game

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractGame, MagicTetris, SampleGame

    public interface Game
    Interface for a Tetris-like game. Implementations of this interface should maintain all aspects of the game state. The state consists of a grid of Block objects representing occupied and unoccupied positions, plus a current Shape whose position is normally updated by the step() method and can be altered by the transform(), shiftDown(), shiftLeft(), and shiftRight() methods. An additional part of the game state is the status that is returned by each invocation of the step() method. The status values are described in detail in the GameStatus documentation.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void cycle()
      Performs a cycle() operation on the current shape.
      boolean gameOver()
      Determines whether the game is over, which occurs when a new shape in its initial position collides with occupied cells of the grid.
      Block getBlock(int row, int col)
      Returns the block associated with the given row and column, or null if the location is unoccupied.
      Shape getCurrent()
      Returns the current shape.
      int getHeight()
      Returns the height of the grid.
      java.util.List<Position> getPositionsToCollapse()
      Returns the grid positions to be collapsed.
      int getScore()
      Returns the current score for this game.
      int getWidth()
      Returns the width of the grid.
      boolean shiftLeft()
      Shifts the current shape one cell to the left (decreasing the column), if it is possible to do so without letting it extend beyond the sides or bottom of the grid and without colliding with occupied cells in the grid.
      boolean shiftRight()
      Shifts the current shape one cell to the right (increasing the column), if it is possible to do so without letting it extend beyond the sides or bottom of the grid and without colliding with occupied cells in the grid.
      GameStatus step()
      Transition the game through one discrete step.
      boolean transform()
      Performs a transform() operation on the current shape if it is possible to do so without letting it extend beyond the sides or bottom of the grid and without colliding with occupied cells in the grid.

    • Method Detail

      • step

        GameStatus step()
        Transition the game through one discrete step. A step may consist of
        • shifting the current shape down by one cell
        • changing the status to COLLAPSING when when the current shape cannot be dropped further and completes a collapsible set (e.g., in a standard Tetris game, a collapsible set would be a completed horizontal row)
        • changing the status to STOPPED when the current shape cannot be dropped further, but does not complete a collapsible set
        • changing the status to NEW_SHAPE when a new shape is started at the top of the grid
        • deleting all cells to be collapsed
        • changing the status to GAME_OVER when a new shape collides with occupied positions in the top row
        Returns:
        the game status after the step

      • transform

        boolean transform()
        Performs a transform() operation on the current shape if it is possible to do so without letting it extend beyond the sides or bottom of the grid and without colliding with occupied cells in the grid.
        Returns:
        true if the current shape was moved, false otherwise

      • cycle

        void cycle()
        Performs a cycle() operation on the current shape.

      • shiftLeft

        boolean shiftLeft()
        Shifts the current shape one cell to the left (decreasing the column), if it is possible to do so without letting it extend beyond the sides or bottom of the grid and without colliding with occupied cells in the grid.
        Returns:
        true if the current shape was moved, false otherwise

      • shiftRight

        boolean shiftRight()
        Shifts the current shape one cell to the right (increasing the column), if it is possible to do so without letting it extend beyond the sides or bottom of the grid and without colliding with occupied cells in the grid.
        Returns:
        true if the current shape was moved, false otherwise

      • getBlock

        Block getBlock(int row,
               int col)
        Returns the block associated with the given row and column, or null if the location is unoccupied.
        Parameters:
        row - the row of the cell
        col - the column of the cell
        Returns:
        the block associated with the given row/column in the grid

      • getCurrent

        Shape getCurrent()
        Returns the current shape.
        Returns:
        the current shape.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the game status is COLLAPSING or GAME_OVER

      • getWidth

        int getWidth()
        Returns the width of the grid.
        Returns:
        the width of the grid.

      • getHeight

        int getHeight()
        Returns the height of the grid.
        Returns:
        the height of the grid.

      • getPositionsToCollapse

        java.util.List<Position> getPositionsToCollapse()
        Returns the grid positions to be collapsed. This method can only be called when the game state is COLLAPSING. The returned list is in no particular order and may contain duplicates. (The purpose of this method is to allow clients to apply special rendering or animation to the collapsing positions.)
        Returns:
        list of Position objects representing the the grid positions to be collapsed
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the game status is not COLLAPSING

      • getScore

        int getScore()
        Returns the current score for this game.
        Returns:
        the current score for this game

      • gameOver

        boolean gameOver()
        Determines whether the game is over, which occurs when a new shape in its initial position collides with occupied cells of the grid.
        Returns:
        true if the game is over, false otherwise
